storyInfo: The daughter of a duke who has abandoned her past lives in seclusion in small village in a remote valley, where she befriends a kind, simple family.

attributes.content: So you’re finally here.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Hui-chieh.
Hui-chieh:
The storm hasn’t broken for days. The whole valley’s snowed over.
The raspberry bushes still haven’t budded. It’s like spring’ll never come.
We’re trapped here, starving, dressed thin, and every silent day we pass waiting for the snow to melt drives us out of our minds.
You know, there’s something about it all I find odd.
We’ve never once had a smooth time of it. Any better circumstances, and they’d go to shit fast the moment I get involved.
Maybe it really is like the Lungmenites say. I’m a bad omen. Nothing good comes of being around me.
Reminds me of something from a hell of a long time ago.
I've been thinking how I need to share my thoughts with you, in order to find peace.
December 14th
Third year without the Black Snake
A small Ursus hamlet
Talulah, get back here! You can’t let them see you like that, for heaven’s sakes.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Don’t worry! I’m coming in now.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Why won’t you just take those clothes off?! I’ve said it over and over, they’ll bring those damned bugs around!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Those big, black, poisonous bugs... One bite and a whole field goes barren!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I always wear my normal clothes, don’t I? I’ve only been wearing these lately because I had to be outside.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You remember the gentleman who gave me these clothes, don’t you? The handsome one. He wouldn’t recognize me in anything else.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I believe destiny will send him to me again. When that time comes, you and your husband can both live happily ever after.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Bah! Talulah... Talulah! A bald-faced liar, that’s what you are. What about everything you said before, then?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Oh. What was it I said before? I’ve forgotten. It was the same, wasn’t it?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You said your father gave you these clothes as a birthday gift!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: You said he was robbed blind by some ring-headed foreigner, and you ran off crying, these clothes soaked in his blood!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: You’re all over the place... The time before that was a different story too!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Ah, so I can’t keep it straight? Your memory’s just wonderful.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Don’t suck up to me! Always talking complete nonsense... I’ve got a foot in the grave, but look at you, running an old coot like me in circles. Don’t you feel even a bit of shame?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Ah. I’m sorry, that’s wrong of me. Really.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Now sit down! Don’t bother with your clothes! Driving me up the wall!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Chop, chop! Polish off that lunch already. You told me you’d be back by noon and the sun’s almost down!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I left the soup on for you, but it’s nearly boiled dry now. You may as well be having your supper at this rate!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Oh, dear Majesty, how could our little girl turn out this way...?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Get that down, you. The old man still wants you for something. Oh, that miserable drunk! Where’s he run off now...? You’ll have to find him yourself.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Alright, I get it.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Hmph! You grew up so well, but not a single true word comes out of your mouth! Just like all those sweet-talking youngsters in the city!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I nearly got swindled once when I was younger... There’s nothing good about them!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Enough... I’ve heard this one a hundred times.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Talking back! Right... here. Oh, come on, take your plate now! And eat your bread, snappity-snap!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Don’t rush like that! You’ll choke!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: ...*Sigh*, you were all soaked in blood the day you showed up, though.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I still get chills thinking about it, Talulah. If you weren’t one of those good kids, the old man would’ve split your head open with a hatchet right then and there.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Who can even tell if someone else is good or bad at a single glance...?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: That day you ran here, it was an evening dark as dark was, with all beasts crawling outside. Burdenbeasts or meatbeasts, they never stopped howling! Really made me uneasy...
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: And then, and then that thing you were carrying...
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Unf, pff... *cough* *cough*!
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: What a big knife it was! I’d never seen one so big in all my years!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: That was a sword... a sword! Not a knife. And don’t take it to clear out mountain paths again. That’s not what it’s for.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: And by the way! Didn’t we agree never to speak of that again? I’m getting upset.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Whoops, my big mouth! Pfeh! Oh, Emperor above! I won’t say a word more, not a single word of it again! Oh, Your Majesty, forgive an old blabbermouth for her careless slip!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: That’s enough. Surely the Emperor’s in no place to care. He’s living it up just fine in his grand old city, and us? We can’t even find potatoes to eat next week. He couldn’t do anything for us, even if he wanted to.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: For that matter, I’m wondering if you even know who the Emperor is now?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: How rude!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: The soup... are we out of salt?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Yes! We ran out a while ago. The salt jar went empty last night! Hmph, you’re just as wasteful as that old man! Eating all our salt... you’ll pickle yourselves dead!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: And Lord knows what in the world you’re up to when you leave for days at a time! You come back with nothing, no money, not even a thing to eat! A girl driving this house to ruin...!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I get it, I get it. I’m changing it out now.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: So healthy you are! You ought to be working!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Don’t bother. I had a chat with Alina just a minute ago. She’ll bring us some salt. Now look at you!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Alina is a lot more reliable than you! She likes her studying, she gets hands-on with her work, and you still can’t even sew your own clothes!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: ...To each their own.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Eh? What do you mean?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Everyone has her own ambitions.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: So what ambitions have you got? Ought to find someone good, a strong lad ‘n’ lass! If we leave you to do the work, mossoat’ll be rotting underground before long.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I haven’t slacked once on the yearly farmwork.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You’ve only been here how many years?!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Talulah never falls behind on her work. Please stop scolding her.
Alina! You need to help me talk some sense into her, or else she’ll keep going on like this, and...
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: And there’s not much wrong with that.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Oh, at last, you’re here. You’re the only one who knows how to quiet her down.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: So you’re all grown up, are you! Think you’re a noble just because you draped yourself in some uniform you got from Lord-knows-where? Small as you are, you put on airs anyway! Where’d you learn that...?!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I have work to do! You two eat up. If you’re hungry, Alina. Talulah, don’t eat too much! Leave some for Alina.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Alright, alright... alright.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I’ll be fine, Ma’am. Thank you.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Talulah, I’ve brought some salt over. The salt merchant will be here next week, so remember to buy some then.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Thank you so, so much, Alina. Without you, she’d be going on for another twenty minutes.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I can hear you!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Where’d you go this time?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Nowhere, just out for a walk to feel the wind. Right, the landscape painting you wanted.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Ah, you actually remembered. Thank you, thank you a lot, Talulah.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: This brush type... This isn’t by the local painters.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: The old painter in Shmyr only knows hard strokes. I can’t imagine him using a feather brush. These soft tips, this was a nighteye’s plumage... from before it molted.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Talulah, you went to the city.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: ...Can’t hide anything from you.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Why hide things from me? I’m not Gendarmerie. Or a tax collector.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: You don’t need to know about any of it. It’s danger all around there.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: And you’re in the thick of it, then?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: The deer facing her seemed almost supernatural. The white-haired Draco felt, deep down, that if you didn’t want Alina to know what was happening, your best option was not to let those things happen at all.
I’m just saying... Alina, you don’t need to worry about th—
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Trouble! There’s trouble...!
attributes.name: Ursus Farmer

attributes.content: What’s all the racket about?! Storming in without even knocking! I don’t know what I’ll do if the bolt’s broken!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: The... The Infected Patrol Unit!
attributes.name: Ursus Farmer

attributes.content: Your old man brought this rabble on us!
attributes.name: Ursus Farmer

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Talulah! Where are you going?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Oh, the knife! Alina, don’t let her wave that thing around!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Let me repeat myself, old boy. I could just break your leg and come in all the same.
attributes.name: Infected Patrol Unit

attributes.content: You’ve already come searching before! What’re you here for now?! We can’t even afford your taxes anymore! What more do you want to wring out of us?!
attributes.name: Old Man

attributes.content: This is a routine inspection! We don’t care how you try to sweeten the pot this time, we’re mandated to inspect every two years... If we don’t carry this out, then we’re all in for the whip.
attributes.name: Infected Patrol Unit

attributes.content: But if you just consent...
attributes.name: Infected Patrol Unit

attributes.content: We can’t give anything anymore! We’ve got nothing to give! No money, no jewelry, not even any more food!
attributes.name: Old Man

attributes.content: The hell are you going on for?
attributes.name: Infected Patrol Unit

attributes.content: This is a routine inspection! Out of the way!
attributes.name: Infected Patrol Unit

attributes.content: Sir, sir! Officer, sir, we’ve got nothing left to give, honest to heaven! If you need to take something with you, just take me, for God’s sakes!
attributes.name: Old Man

attributes.content: I said OUT OF THE WAY!
attributes.name: Infected Patrol Unit

attributes.content: Agh!
attributes.name: Old Man

attributes.content: Guh... My leg...
attributes.name: Old Man

attributes.content: What are you doing?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Hm? Some girl from somewhere...
attributes.name: Infected Patrol Unit

attributes.content: —Hey. Your clothes there. Where’d you come from? No farmer could afford to wear those.
attributes.name: Infected Patrol Unit

attributes.content: I’m asking. What are you doing?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Infected Patrol Unit

attributes.content: Not a step closer! What do you think you’re doing? Have you seen your eyes...? Hah, don’t you look terrifying!
attributes.name: Infected Patrol Unit

attributes.content: —Do I see a death wish?!
attributes.name: Infected Patrol Unit
